title: Core TUI MVP - Full beads interactive TUI
description:
Build a complete interactive TUI for beads (bd) using Python + Textual framework.

## Architecture
- beads_tui/ package with __main__.py entry point (python -m beads_tui)
- bd_client.py: subprocess wrapper around bd CLI using --json flag
- models.py: dataclasses for Issue, Comment, etc.
- app.py: main Textual App class
- screens/: Textual screens (main list, detail, create form)
- widgets/: custom widgets (issue table, filter bar, pickers)
- styles/app.tcss: CSS theme

## Features Required
1. Main list view: DataTable with all issues, color-coded by priority & status
2. Detail panel: full issue details in side panel or overlay screen
3. Inline editing: change priority (p), status (s), assignee (a), title (e)
4. Create form: modal form to create new issues (c)
5. Search/filter: text search + filter by status/priority/type
6. Comments: view and add comments on issues
7. Labels: view and manage labels
8. Close/reopen issues
9. Live reload: periodic polling with diff-based updates (no flicker)
10. Beautiful CSS theme with color-coded priorities and statuses
11. Full keyboard navigation with help overlay (?)
12. Status bar showing db stats and active filters

## Dependencies
- textual (only external dep)
- stdlib: subprocess, json, dataclasses, asyncio, pathlib

## bd CLI commands to wrap
- bd list --json
- bd show <id> --json
- bd update <id> (--title, --status, --priority, --assignee, --description, etc.)
- bd create (--title, --description, --priority, --type, --assignee, --labels)
- bd close <id> / bd reopen <id>
- bd search <query> --json
- bd comments <id> --json / bd comments add <id> 'text'
- bd label add/remove <id> <label>
- bd status --json

## Quality Requirements
- Zero flicker: use Textual reactive attributes and worker threads
- Live reload: timer-based polling every 2-3 seconds, only update changed data
- Beautiful: rich color theme, clean layout, visual hierarchy
- Easy to use: intuitive keybindings, contextual help
- Minimal deps: only textual + stdlib
